analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽(The Paṭṭhāna Treatise, in the form of the Triad and Dyad Lists, is not included in this e-text, but is available in the Pali Text Society’s edition of the Paṭṭhāna, edited by U Rewata Dhamma.)

original: 16.10. Kusalattika, Rūpīduka🔽Abyākataṁ rūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo narūpī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ🔽rūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo narūpī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ rūpiṁ
analyzed: kusalattika rūpīduka  abyākatam rūpim dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na rūpī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākata  rūpim dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na rūpī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam rūpi
translated: The Triad on the Wholesome, the Dyad on the Formless🔽With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a wholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of root condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a wholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of object condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a wholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of root condition and object condition.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo narūpī ca naakusalo narūpī ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na rūpī ca na akusalaḥ na rūpī ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a unwholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of root condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a unwholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of object condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a unwholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of root condition and object condition.🔽With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a wholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of object condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a unwholesome, immaterial state arises, a condition by way of object condition. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, a wholesome, immaterial state and a unwholesome, immaterial state arise, a condition by way of object condition.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Kusalaṁ arūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca tīṇi. Akusalaṁ arūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca tīṇi. Abyākataṁ
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  kusalam arūpim dhammam paṭicca tīṇi akusalam arūpim dhammam paṭicca tīṇi abyākata
translated: With root cause as condition, there are three. … With an unobscured, indeterminate state as condition, there are three.

original: arūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca tīṇi. Hetuyā nava …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: arūpim dhammam paṭicca tīṇi hetuyā nava pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate nava
translated: With a wholesome, immaterial state as condition, there are three. With an unwholesome, immaterial state as condition, there are three. With an unobscured, indeterminate, immaterial state as condition, there are three. With root cause as condition, there are nine. … With reciprocal condition, there are three. … With result as condition, there are three. … With an unobscured, indeterminate state as condition, there are nine.
